intro: Agriophyllum paletzkianum, commonly known as the palezkian thornbush, is a flowering plant native to the arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Chenopodiaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, shrub-like structure with dense, woolly foliage. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in terminal inflorescences. It is adapted to harsh environmental conditions, exhibiting drought tolerance and salt resistance. Its ecological role includes soil stabilization and providing habitat for various desert organisms.
